SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ClientPostTls

public interface ClientPostTls
Operations available after TLS upgrade.

This interface is provided to the handler after STARTTLS succeeds and the TLS handshake completes. Per RFC 3207, the client must re-issue EHLO after TLS upgrade to learn the server's post-TLS capabilities.

The only operation available is ehlo() - this interface enforces the RFC requirement that EHLO must be re-sent after STARTTLS.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • ServerStarttlsReplyHandler.handleTlsEstablished(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientPostTls)

  • Method Details

    • ehlo

      void ehlo(String hostname, ServerEhloReplyHandler callback)
      Re-issues EHLO after TLS upgrade.

      Per RFC 3207, this is required after STARTTLS. The server may advertise different capabilities over the encrypted connection (e.g., additional AUTH mechanisms).

      Parameters:
      hostname - the client's hostname to announce
      callback - receives the server's response

    • quit

      void quit()
      Closes the connection.

      Use this to abort if TLS succeeded but the handler decides not to continue (e.g., certificate validation failure at application level).
